required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Same-session MR-only Simulation and Treatment With MRI-guided Adaptive Palliative RadioTherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of Same-session MR-only Simulation and Treatment With MRI-guided Adaptive Palliative RadioTherapy (MAP-RT)

brief_summary.textblock: This proposed study is unique in that patients will not undergo computed tomography (CT) simulation at any point during their treatment course and will instead have same-session magnetic resonance (MR)-only simulation and treatment planning, on-table, using the adaptive radiotherapy (ART) workflow. In this manner, patients requiring urgent treatment could initiate treatment as early as the day of initial radiation oncology consultation.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of same-session MRI-only simulation as measured by the number of participants who receive at least 70% of their scheduled treatment fractions on the first on-table attempt for each respective fraction

arm_group.description: All patients will undergo volumetric MR imaging on treatment days in positioning appropriate for the specific treatment site. Patients will receive standard of care palliative radiation therapy

intervention.description: This will most frequently be supine with arms positioned so not in the way of treatment beams.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of malignancy (biopsy proven or high clinical suspicion with urgent/emergent clinical indications for palliative RT)
- Requires delivery of palliative radiation therapy for the treatment of painful metastasis, hemoptysis, gastrointestinal bleeding, pelvic bleeding, or superior vena cava syndrome/bulky mediastinal disease.
- At least 18 years of age.
- Able to understand and willing to sign an IRB-approved written informed consent document.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant. Patients of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test within 14 days of study entry.
- Medical contraindication to undergoing MR imaging.

link.description: Alvin J. Siteman Cancer Center at Barnes-Jewish Hospital and Washington University School of Medicine

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in this article, after deidentification (text, tables, figures and appendices). Participants who opted out of data sharing in the informed consent will not be included.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 3 months and ending 5 years following article publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researches must provide a methodologically sound proposal. Proposals should be directed to kim.hyun@wustl.edu. To gain access, data requestors will need to sign a data access agreement and provide proof of appropriate regulatory approvals as necessary.
